channel.title: Comments on: Are you ready for SQL Server 2012 or are you still partying like it is 1999?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Manoj
item.dc:creator: Manoj
item.description: good one. still have to go through all your series....<br /> thanks for sharing this.
item.content:encoded:
good one. still have to go through all your series….
thanks for sharing this.

item.title: By: Richard Lewis
item.dc:creator: Richard Lewis
item.description: I look forward to reading you series i'm still running a SQL 2000 database in production which is slated to migrate over next year anyway.
item.content:encoded: I look forward to reading you series i’m still running a SQL 2000 database in production which is slated to migrate over next year anyway.

item.title: By: Jack Corbett
item.dc:creator: Jack Corbett
item.content:encoded:
I’m surprised that there are people out there who can’t whiteboard ROW_NUMBER(). There are so many places where it can be used to solve problems. I might not be able to explain everything new in 2008 & R2, but I know most of it.

I do try to keep up, but honestly I learn/retain what I need to get my job done on a daily basis. I really on get surface knowledge of the newer technologies so I can try to understand situations where they would be helpful so I can intelligently present valid upgrade reasons to the boss.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Top talent is one thing..having 10 years experience but not be able to write a group by..having count(*) query is another thing
or not know what the biggest number you can store in decimal(6,5) is just something a developer with 2 years experience should know

Ask people when they can’t do a truncate and you will get all kind of creative answers

Difference between UNION and UNION ALL is another question where the answers are very very surprising

item.title: By: Robert L Davis
item.dc:creator: Robert L Davis
item.content:encoded:
I see a lot of people complaining about the quality of candidates coming in for interviews. At the same time, I see a lot job offerings that are not geared to finding the top talent. Everyone seems to want to hire top talent, but nobody wants to pay for it.

If you’re paying bottom tier or middle tier rates, you’re only going to get bottom tier or middle tier candidates.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Rob,

thanks for the comment…what you are saying is true..that is also why I will cover stuff that was added in 2005 and 2008 only. I see database on 2008 and they are still inserting into a temp table with an identity column or are doing a running count to get a row number, why not use ROW_NUMBER() instead? That is what I am focusing on with these posts…bringing the code up to 2005 and 2008 level from 2000 and earlier. I won’t really cover any 2012 stuff or I might just mention it at the end and show a small example of how it is done in 2012…OFFSET for paging instead of ROW_NUMBER() is such an example

item.title: By: Rob Sullivan
item.dc:creator: Rob Sullivan
item.description: I'm excited about SQL Server 2012 just as much as the next guy... but good time management also tells me it is still quite a few months away from being a purchasable product. With that in mind, I'm focusing on learning real products until the actual product launch gets closer.... or set for that matter.
item.content:encoded: I’m excited about SQL Server 2012 just as much as the next guy… but good time management also tells me it is still quite a few months away from being a purchasable product. With that in mind, I’m focusing on learning real products until the actual product launch gets closer…. or set for that matter.
